originalText.text: I highly recommend TD Podiatry. The staff is kind and professional. I’ve always been able to book an appointment easily. The office has multiple locations and the space is clean and inviting. Dr. Shields is professional and attentive. I came in with a tough ankle issue early in the fall and he has guided me through the process to recovery. I’m grateful to be going through this process with Dr. Shields at TD Podiatry.

text.text: I highly recommend TD Podiatry. The staff is kind and professional. I’ve always been able to book an appointment easily. The office has multiple locations and the space is clean and inviting. Dr. Shields is professional and attentive. I came in with a tough ankle issue early in the fall and he has guided me through the process to recovery. I’m grateful to be going through this process with Dr. Shields at TD Podiatry.

originalText.text: The team at TDpodiatry is fantastic! The receptionists are kind and welcoming. I see Dr. Shields and he’s always given me excellent, attentive, and empathetic care! I’ve recommended a family member and they say the same. I’d highly recommend this team!

text.text: The team at TDpodiatry is fantastic! The receptionists are kind and welcoming. I see Dr. Shields and he’s always given me excellent, attentive, and empathetic care! I’ve recommended a family member and they say the same. I’d highly recommend this team!

originalText.text: Melissa / Dr. shields along with the Front desk girls Manuela and Leslie are amazing and super professional. Definitely very clean and well kept office highly recommended. Manager Savannah is amazing and always willing to give a helping hand even on her days off.. TD Podiatry the way to go…

text.text: Melissa / Dr. shields along with the Front desk girls Manuela and Leslie are amazing and super professional. Definitely very clean and well kept office highly recommended. Manager Savannah is amazing and always willing to give a helping hand even on her days off.. TD Podiatry the way to go…

originalText.text: Dr Shields and his medical assistant Melissa are great medical professionals. In addition to providing the best care, both really take the time to simply explain why you’re having the problems you have and then curate a personalized plan of action to best cure your problems. This high level of attentiveness and care is the reason why I recommend these two and will use them in the future if I ever run into any other issues.

text.text: Dr Shields and his medical assistant Melissa are great medical professionals. originalText.text:
These "doctors" are a joke.

I came in for two ingrown toenails. They said I would need them occluded but couldn't do it then, and had to come back two more times for each nail, because they wanted to bill me three times rather than once.

When I came back, "doctor" Montalvo did the procedure, occluding two sides of one nail and applying acid to stop regrowth, but did not properly anesthetize me, so it hurt terribly. They said I was fine to walk home on it, but when I arrived home and took my shoe off, my sock was soaked in blood because my toe wasn't properly bandaged. When I took the bandage off, I could see he did a very sloppy job.

Over the following months, the nail grew back ingrown even worse, and was incredibly painful. While on a trip, I called their office to ask if there was anything I could do, and they prescribed me oral antibiotics, without any explanation. When I called back for an explanation, "doctor" Tamir said I would have to come in for them to explain it to me (so they can bill me again). When I suggested that taking antibiotics for no reason is not medically advised, the "doctor" berated me with very rude language and insisted that he knows best, because he's a "doctor", even though what he said is directly contradictory to what real doctors advised me to do. Keep in mind that Podiatrists are not MDs, they undergo very little training and were not deemed "essential" during the pandemic because they have no medical knowledge apart from feet.

Now I need the same procedure redone and I have found a new, better Podiatrist. In talking to them, I have learned that TD botched the procedure in multiple ways; not using proper anesthesia and not correctly applying the acid. Not to mention, the people who run the place are jerks on a power trip, and I'm sure they will respond aggressively to this review, which is fine, because now the truth about them is out there. Avoid.
